ygData.subject: RE: Guise of the Deceiver question
ygData.msgSnippet: it does modify your factions when you morph, im currently playing my troll SK and he s kos in many places that he is not KOS as a DE. and rest assured i ve
ygData.messageBody:
it does modify your factions when you morph, im currently playing my troll
SK and he's kos in many places that he is not KOS as a DE. and rest assured
i've seen plenty ppl get killed or escape by jumping off the platform cause
of morphing by accident in kelethin (my friend being one of em hehe). dont
think my buddy was ever so shocked as to when he got jumped by everything to
the zone.... i must admit it was a nice train he had on him

Minkin lev 36 bard
Razan lev 40 sk
Sol Ro

> -----Original Message-----
> From: SteelWolf [SMTP:steelwolf@...]
> Sent: Monday, December 06, 1999 2:02 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Guise of the Deceiver question
>
> From: SteelWolf <steelwolf@...>
>
> I saw a Erudite banking peacefully in Felwithe, and fire off his guise
> (showing off or by accident) and the pair of bankers promptly destroyed
> him. I've never seen a L50 die that fast.
>
> Not sure why this happened, but I don't believe his Felwithe faction was
> abnormally low. Anyone else know?
>
> Arill Thunderwolf, Karana
>
> > I was concerned that when in dark elf form I would be attacked by the
> guards
> > and inhabitants of the good aligned cities I am normally looked upon
> kindly
> > or warmly by, but this is not the case. Apparently you keep all your
> > faction adjustments while under the dark elf illusion of the guise.
>
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
> with the subject submissions.
